test_GA1A1S202WP_lightSensor.cpp

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 // Do not remove the include below
00002 #include "test_GA1A1S202WP_lightSensor.h"
00003 
00004 
00005 /*
00006   Test sketch for the Adafruit Analog Light Sensor
00007   by Bill Earl
00008   for Adafruit Industries
00009 
00010   Edited by GO M. on 2014-02-19:
00011     * Encapsulated sensor data input into a specific function
00012     * Formed output into a frame
00013 
00014   Connect sensor output to Analog Pin 0
00015   Connect 5v to VCC and GND to GND
00016   Connect 3.3v to the AREF pin
00017 
00018   Source: http://learn.adafruit.com/adafruit-ga1a12s202-log-scale-analog-light-sensor/use-it
00019  */
00020 
00021 int sensorPin = A0;    // select the input pin for the potentiometer
00022 
00023 float rawRange = 1024; // 3.3v
00024 float logRange = 5.0; // 3.3v = 10^5 lux
00025 
00026 
00027 static const float C_MAX_LUM    = pow( 10, logRange );
00028 
00029 void setup()
00030 {
00031     /* Use the 3.3V external reference (on AREF pin) instead of internal 5V one. */
00032     analogReference(EXTERNAL);
00033 
00034     /* Setup serial interface */
00035     Serial.begin( 115200 );
00036     Serial.println("Adafruit Analog Light Sensor Test");
00037 }
00038 
00039 
00040 void loop()
00041 {
00042     Serial.print( "$test_GA1A1S202WP_lightSensor;" );
00043     Serial.print( analogRead(sensorPin) );
00044     Serial.print( ";" );
00045     Serial.print( getSensorData() );
00046     Serial.print( ";" );
00047     Serial.print( C_MAX_LUM );
00048     Serial.println( "*" );
00049 
00050 //    Serial.print("Raw = ");
00051 //    Serial.print(rawValue);
00052 //    Serial.print(" - Lux = ");
00053 //    Serial.println(RawToLux(rawValue));
00054 
00055     delay(100);
00056 }
00057 
00058 float getSensorData( void )
00059 {
00060     // read the raw value from the sensor:
00061     int rawValue = analogRead(sensorPin);
00062 
00063     float logLux = rawValue * logRange / rawRange;
00064     return pow(10, logLux);
00065 }
